intro: Trichosanthes fatoa, commonly known as the African horned melon, is a climbing vine native to tropical Africa. It produces large, spiky, green to yellowish fruits that are edible when ripe. The plant belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squash. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with a rough texture. The flowers are yellow with five petals and are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant.
